instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.CHGR_DCIN: What is CHGR_DCIN? CHGR_DCIN comes directly from charger into ISL6258 or ISL6259, the resistor before it can be blown when there are surges. Should be checked when PPBUS_G3H is missing.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid Damage
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Terrible coffee damage
First time I had to use the USC in quite a while. It's nice and clean now, but a handful of areas were affected I'm trying to work through.
The first problem was <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> was shorted. I injected to try and find it... and the board got very hot on the left side and then cleared the short on it's own. Still not sure what exactly caused it. I'm now reading 0.001v, but not shorted.
Going through the steps now:
[URL='https://logi.wiki/index.php/G3_to_S3_State_for_Ivy_Bridge_Haswell_and_Broadwell?fbclid=IwAR2zcWd4iftGrbht-UNMhpTd-9Y8ECmzPHeN91IC4dAdDriSOuFaXspkuZg']https://logi.wiki/.../G3_to_S3_State_for_Ivy_Bridge...[/URL]

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is 16.2v ... link says it should be 14.5. Is this concerning?
<SIGNAL>DCIN_ISOL_GATE_R</SIGNAL> is 6.8v as it should be.
<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> is 4.3v instead of 3.3v...
<SIGNAL>CHGR_DCIN</SIGNAL> is also 16.4v, is that too high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Concerned voltages depend by charger type (powr).
You are using 60W probably; however is nothing to worry.

Post diode mode for 3V42 power rail and <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> voltages.
Be sure both <RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>/96 are good, as traces too.
What about <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Ah ok thx, I am using genuine 85w charger. 

Diode mode 3v42 is 0.311

<CHIP>U7090</CHIP>:
... 
Went to measure and noticed <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> was wiped off the map. Replaced... and I have green light and fan spin. I'll report back if there are further issues. 

As always, thanks :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid Damage
threads.message: Ok. So last night it did power up and give me backlight. This morning, I get fan spin, but no image or backlight. USB mouse does light up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Use an USB pendrive with Link LED to confirm USB activity,
A mouse is not the best test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid Damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid Damage
threads.message:
The board is not booting with 60mA.
Check for any missing, or incorrect secondary voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid Damage
threads.message: I inspected the entire board very carefully and touched up any nasty solder, replaced a couple sketchy components. Board boots up nicely every time now. On to the next!
